questions.question: ______ is a curve that is formed by a point on the circumference of a circle, having another circle rolling inside it.
questions.explanation: A hypocycloid is traced by a point on a circle rolling inside another circle.

questions.question: When the circle rolls along another circle outside it, without slipping, it is known as _________.
questions.explanation: An epicycloid is generated when a circle rolls on the outside of another circle.

questions.question: The directing circle is known as the rolling circle.
questions.explanation: The directing circle is fixed, while the rolling circle is the one that moves.

questions.question: In a hypocycloid, the generating circle is found inside the directing circle.
questions.explanation: A hypocycloid is formed when a generating circle rolls inside a directing circle.

questions.question: What is point on the generating circle that traces the curve known as?
questions.explanation: The generating point is the point on the rolling circle that traces the curve.

questions.question: Which of the following curve is formed by tracing a point on the circumference of a rolling circle whose radius is almost twice the radius of a fixed circle.
questions.explanation: An epicycloid forms when a larger circle rolls outside a smaller fixed circle.

questions.question: Does the radius of rolling circle affect the size of a cycloid?
questions.explanation: The radius of the rolling circle determines the height and length of the cycloid arc.
